data.title: Is there a way to compare files side by side ?
data.body:
I would like to compare two files  side-by-side, like the "Split" mode on Github.

Is tere a way to achieve this at the moment ? Or any package allowing it ?

data.title: Uncaught Error: Cannot find module
data.body:
This error is thrown randomly some times when I start atom.

Uncaught Error: Cannot find module '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/git-diff'

**Atom Version**: 0.155.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.9.5
**Thrown From**: 'minimap-git-diff' package, vundefined
### Steps To Reproduce
1. Start atom from terminal in a folder [$] atom .
### Stack Trace

```
At module.js:346

Error: Cannot find module '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/git-diff'
  at Module._resolveFilename (module.js:344:15)
  at Function.Module._resolveFilename (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/module-cache.js:380:52)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:286:25)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at new MinimapGitDiffBinding (/Users/yriveiro/.atom/packages/minimap-git-diff/lib/minimap-git-diff-binding.coffee:13:16)
  at /Users/yriveiro/.atom/packages/minimap-git-diff/lib/minimap-git-diff.coffee:63:21
  at createdCallback (/Users/yriveiro/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:53:40)
  at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:71:11)
  at Minimap.module.exports.ViewManagement.onEditorAdded (/Users/yriveiro/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:110:14)
  at /Users/yriveiro/.atom/packages/minimap/lib/mixins/view-management.coffee:85:37

```

data.title: Uncaught Error: spawn /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper EAGAIN
data.body:
Uncaught Error: spawn /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper EAGAIN

**Atom Version**: 0.155.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.9.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

This and/or #4486 has other effects, though, like some Terminal commands begin to respond with "Resource temporarily unavailable" until Atom is closed. 
### Steps To Reproduce
1. It happens seemingly randomly. 
### Stack Trace

```
At events.js:85

Error: spawn /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper EAGAIN

  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1051:32)
  at child_process.js:1142:20
  at process._tickCallback (node.js:378:11)
```


data.title: Add ability to view apm package release notes
data.body:
It would be awesome to be able to view release notes in Atom (if they exist) for apm packages too, instead of only being able view Atom's release notes. 

FWIW, I don't think this should work the way Package Control handles package release notes in Sublime (ie. popping up a new tab with a plain-text changelog for each updated package) - it should be less obtrusive than that, similar to how viewing Atom release notes works now.

data.title: cannot delete folders from project tree
data.body:
using latest version (0.155.0)
using the "project manager" package.

when i select a folder on the left side project tree, right click and select "delete"
nothing happens.

EDIT: apparently it was permission issue, but still, no indication in editor, you select to delete and nothing happens.

data.title: "Create Issue On atom/atom" button isn't working
data.body:
An error occurred while I was working in Atom. The error (message) asked me if I wanted to create an issue on GitHub, but clicking on the button did nothing.

Here is a picture of the error message.
![Image of error message](http://take.ms/j4R24)

Regarding the error: it happened while I had a multiline selection with pipes, like this:

``` ruby
|
|
|
```

I tried to indent those lines with tabs, then the error occurred.

``` ruby
-->  |
-->  |
-->  |
```

data.title: Failed to load keymap.cson
data.body:
My cson:

``` cson
# Your keymap
#
# Atom keymaps work similarly to stylesheets. Just as stylesheets use selectors
# to apply styles to elements, Atom keymaps use selectors to associate
# keystrokes with events in specific contexts.
#
# You can create a new keybinding in this file by typing "key" and then hitting
# tab.
#
# Here's an example taken from Atom's built-in keymap:
#
# 'atom-text-editor':
#   'enter': 'editor:newline'
#
# 'atom-workspace':
#   'ctrl-shift-p': 'core:move-up'
#   'ctrl-p': 'core:move-down'
#
# You can find more information about keymaps in these guides:
# * https://atom.io/docs/latest/customizing-atom#customizing-key-bindings
# * https://atom.io/docs/latest/advanced/keymaps
#
# This file uses CoffeeScript Object Notation (CSON).
# If you are unfamiliar with CSON, you can read more about it here:
# https://github.com/bevry/cson#what-is-cson
'atom-text-editor':
'ctrl-left': 'editor:move-to-beginning-of-word'
'ctrl-right': 'editor:move-to-end-of-word'
'.autocomplete input.hidden-input':
'enter': 'autocomplete:confirm'
'.autocomplete-plus input.hidden-input':
'enter': 'autocomplete-plus:confirm'
'atom-workspace atom-text-editor:not([mini])':
'ctrl-alt-|': 'editor:toggle-line-comments'
```

Error in console:

```
Failed to reload key bindings file: /home/davide/.atom/keymap.cson [stdin]:26:20: error: unexpected newline
'atom-text-editor':[1;31m[0m
[1;31m                   ^[0m /opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:324
```

data.title: char ` makes atom displaying an extra non-exist space
Annoying blue lines when coding php
data.body:
I updated to latest Atom yesterday (154) , I'm using the Seti Syntax and in it when coding in php whenever the cursor is within a brackets 2 annoying blue lines appear at the top of the window. 

This only occurs in Seti Syntax UI. System Linux Mint 17

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2173259/5372992/d8ee4da4-8076-11e4-834d-d5986000728a.png)

data.title: Full screen focus error
data.body: When Atom is in full screen and I switch to another app (in this case iTerm in full screen - I have hotkeys assigned to each) Atom doesn't quite regain a full focus. The menu bar says "Atom" and if I type it will type within the open tab but it doesn't always respond to commands such as Cmd-P for a file dialog. So I hit Cmd-P and start typing a file name but instead it just writes it in the open tab fie,  Seems to be mosly related to full screen I believe.

data.title: Uncaught Error: spawn puppet ENOENT
data.body:
Uncaught Error: spawn puppet ENOENT

**Atom Version**: 0.154.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Steps To Reproduce
1. simply opened a blank file named "default.pp" in a manifests folder (one folder deep in to my file hirearchy)
2. tried adding a simple package block, closed and reopend atom but error persists

